sub_title: Trains professional performers to enhance their talent | Dramaturge | Choreographer | Dance & Theatre Lecturer |
summary:
One of the most essential things in life is our body. Our body is our being. I discovered the relevance of body issues through my experience as a dance performer around the world and later, as a yoga practitioner.
I believe that dance training is productive when there is an integral framework where body, mind, awareness, and emotion are gathered. That approach is what enables the quality of a performative body, which is intimately linked to the creation of the dramaturgy of dance. That is what I stand for.
Every dancer settles intuitive strategies to move, then to awake, to tune the bodily intelligence of a performer is what drives me into the practice.

Due to my broad education and experience, my expertise is diverse. My main activities are now concentrated on ⌦

✼ Artistic director, leader, and choreographer:
➤ I work in projects-based and dance theatre productions
➤ Cross-cultural theatre assignments commissioned by the Dance Theatre Development Foundation [DTD stg]

✼ Teaching, I guide lessons in dance and theatre to scholars and vocational dancers in:
➤Integral contemporary dance technique
➤Yoga and Somatic practices applied to movement 
➤Choreography (structural sequences and improvisation) 
➤Tango Argentino (applied technique) 

✼Mentoring:
➤Mentor for personal and professional development

✼Training for:
➤Dance/theatre graduate and post-graduate programs 
➤Professional dancers, performers, and actors at companies 

✼Lecturer in:
➤Dramaturgy theory of Contemporary dance/theater 
➤History of dance & theatre
➤Didactics, pedagogy of dance

✼Dramaturge, I work for: 
➤Co-assistance/co-dramaturge projects-base and productions 
➤Assistance regisseur for production and rehearsal 

FEEL FREE TO CONTACT ME AT ☎ +31(0)640238564. WE CAN DISCUSS COLLABORATIONS LIKE:

 ☛Teaching dance/theater at universities, academies
 ☛Developing concepts for dance/theatre education
 ☛Training performers at dance or theatre companies
 ☛Dramaturgical assistance at theaters and companies
 ☛Giving lecturers dance/theater at institutions
 ☛Conference assistant: protocol, lecturer developer
 ☛Event planner: hosting, programming
 ☛Administrative management: scheduling courses, workshops, performances, call entries, auditions, open days, publicity, communication

organizations.name: IDOCDE International Documentation of Contemporary Dance Education

projects.title: Guest Teacher & Lecturer for professional dance educators. "Gender, transference and subjective body in the contemporary teachings of tango practice”
projects.description:
Tango workshop and lecture (practice & theory) oriented to dance teachers and scholars, professional dancers & performers held during the IV IDOCDE symposium/ ImpulsTanz -Vienna International Dance Festival.
My main concern as a dramaturge during this workshop and lecture is to look at the construction sources of tango in order to rescue its intrinsic structures and pillars. In order to not only revise the methodology of Argentinian tango as practice, I will explore its application to develop 'tango as a contemporary art form'. I will also show the influence of the cultural interaction with the Argentinian dance community.

contributors.headline: Trains professional performers to enhance their talent | Dramaturge | Choreographer | Dance & Theatre Lecturer |

projects.title: Workshop- production "Body, dance and performance workshop- production"
projects.description:
The one-and-a-half week workshop production 'Body, Dance and Performance' is an educative- artistic event that crosses by the dancers learning processes and delivers a clear result: the performance. The one-and-a-half week workshop-production 'Body, Dance and Performance' is being realized in collaboration among Danzalterna, Contemporary Dance Centre, Co. El Sur Mundo Project- and the Ostade A'dam Theatre in Amsterdam.
This workshop-production aims to stimulate a new dance community offering dance training, rehearsals and choreography/lab based on Gabriela Zuarez work style. My aim is to share and co-create my production material within a creative- learning process. The workshop is a challenging experience for those who want to raise their inner dance-performer to the maximum of its possibilities and who are eager to get new insights about dancing and theatre in a concrete product.

contributors.headline: Trains professional performers to enhance their talent | Dramaturge | Choreographer | Dance & Theatre Lecturer |

projects.title: Diptico
projects.description:
'DIPTICO' Art or Success? 
PREMIÉRE Thursday 21 November 20:30 ICOON Theater Amersfoort Vathorst
Dancers: Anabel Eckerling (Israel), Gabriela Zuarez (Holland-Argentine), Judit Koncz (Hungary), Manuela Rivero Gomez (Portugal) 

Díptico is a new-age dance theatre creation which is centered around the person of the artist, its passion, the loss of its identity and the betrayal of ethical and aesthetic worth within the commercial mass production of the arts.
The theme revolves about the deconstruction and demystification of the tango dance as a worldwide art form and it has been created for a female quartet ensemble. Its  setting and location is a Tango salon as site
The piece posits to the viewer an insisting question about what is original and what is an imitation or ultimately a plagiarism. What is live and what is recorded? What is the creative and what is gambled, distorted or taken from the creative? The theme of Díptico inquiries, at the same time, how dancers' bodies are being used and exploited by the performing art industry and its environmental hits.
Dramaturgy- choreography Gabriela Zuarez, Visual design/ Costumes/ Light Micaela Tettamanti (Argentine) Music by A. Troilo Orchestra, Di Sarli Orchestra en Sassone Orchestra, El Arranque Orchestra, Luis Borda en Osvaldo Pugliese Video Siar Sadig Choreographic- dramaturgical Assistance Mireia Izquierdo  Supervision and coaching Nell Berger Foundraising Job Gerlings Marketing & Communication Dana Wams and Monique Biver With Thanks to Jaap van de Klomp, Theatre Icoon and Dance-Theatre Development Foundation.

Díptico has received the support of the City council of Amersfoort, the KF Hein foundation and the Dance-Theatre Development foundation. It is realization has been possible in cooperation with ICOON Theatre and the Rietveldpaviljoen Zonnehof in Amersfoort. El Sur Mundo Project- Performing Arts- is under the auspicies of the Argentinian Embassy in The Hague.

projects.title: Origenes Argentinian Cultural Event
projects.description:
Orígenes' -Argentinian Cultural Event- 5 t/m 9 November 2011 Amersfoort - Utrecht

Origenes is an interdisciplinary program with a main panels of theatre, dance and music and a second panel of expositions, conferencies and workshops. The ideologic trend of 'Orígenes' is based in presenting, enhancing and promoting contemporary developments of the argentinian culture which are out of the usual artistic market circuits. The event pretends an actual, renewend, critical and interdisciplinary perspective. That aims to bring reflexion about the ethics of cultural representation. The politic of this event wants to invite Argentinian artists who are resident in Holland and abroad, Dutch artists and Europeans who feel affinity and identification to participate in the project.
Origenes- Argentinian Cultural Event- is an initiative by El Sur Mundo Project- Performing Arts- in coollaboration with LAVUS,Latin American Association for Students of Utrechtse with other partners organisations as: Stadschouwburg Utrecht, Winkel van Sinkel, Theater De Lieve Vrouw Amersfoort, LAKMA Latin American Art Museum, Stadsgalerij Amersfoort and Instituto Cervantes Utrecht.
Origenes- Argentinian Cultural Event is a project done in collaboration and under the auspicies of the Argentinian Embassy in The Netherlands and the National Department of Culture and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Argentina.
Artistic leader Gabriela Zuarez; General organisation and programation: Amanda Molenaar en Marit Bosman; Production manager Rodney Arnoldus; Promotie Rodney Arnoldus; Advice Anneloes Elbertsen en Loek Polders; Organization Salon Argentino in collaboration with Buenos Aires Tango School, Academia de Tango and Ada Mores; Support: Foundation Dance- Theatre Development; Sociaal Cultureel Fonds van De Amersfoortse Verzekeringen; KFHein Fonds and Mien vant' sant Fonds.

contributors.headline: Trains professional performers to enhance their talent | Dramaturge | Choreographer | Dance & Theatre Lecturer |

projects.title: SUCCESS (work-in-progress)
projects.description:
SUCCESS (work-in-progress) 15-16 May Theater Ostade A'dam Amsterdam
Dancers: Donika Davids, Eric van Voorden, Gabriela Zuarez

SUCCES is the outcoming of a workshop-production 'Body, Dance and Performance' aiming the development of language and in preparation for staging.
The theme in SUCCESS, a man and two women form a certain kind of tribe that’s driven by a survivor’s instinct within the enclosure of a tango salon. The big motive of this production is the identity and vulnerability of the dancer’s body.  SUCCESS is being staged by three performers, three ‘Tangueros’, who are longing for recognition, acceptance and success within a social environment.
In a humoristic way, the dramaturge poses the question if what we see is the original, true form or just a mere representation.  She also emphasizes the exploitation of the artist’s body in our actual society. SUCCESS is a dynamic and tragicomic theatre- dance production in a new dramaturgy that intertwines the language of modern dance with Tango that’s being reinforced by cultural criticism.

Concept/ dramaturgy Gabriela Zuarez Choreography Gabriela Zuarez Light design Micaela Tettamanti; Musical arrangement and sound Lucas Malec; Photography Eric van Voorden; Graphic Design T.Coggiola Packbureau Buenos Aires; Communication Marianne Ten Hoedt; Production Danzalterna. With thanks to Job Gerlings and Roshan Warjawand.
SUCCESS has been developed  during the  workshop-production ‘Body, Dance & Performance’ of the Danzalterna Dance Centre- in collaboration with the theater Ostade A’dam in Amsterdam, the Netherlands.

projects.title: Résumé (work-in progress)
projects.description:
Kick-off 5 November Stadsschouwburg Utrecht 29/30 November Theater Studio Utrecht Univ.
Research period 26 September- 27 November 2011.
Dancers: Fabienne Vegt, Anabel Eckerling, Samuel Garcia Minguillon, Stephano Tauoti, Manuela Rivero

Résumé (work-in progress) is a dance quintet and is inspired on the trend of festivals and competitions for young talents and on the hip of international artistic success. The theme of 'Résumé' deals with the artist's seek for a sensible 'oneness' within an impersonal, globalized world. 'Résumé as piece aims to explore the corporeal manipulation and the subjectivity of the artists' body as an object of the visual cultural consumption and hiperproductivity of our modern era.
Dramaturgy- choreography Gabriela Zuarez; Visual Design- photography Micaela Tettamanti

projects.title: Human Landscapes II
projects.description:
Human Landscapes II  Zandvoort aan de Eem/ L'Observant Amersfoort
Performers: Gabriela Zuarez, Liron Dinovitz en Silke Mehler 

'Human landscapes II' is een resultaat van het Artist Residence Project voor multidisciplinair dans theater onderzoek heeft tot doel het samenbrengen van dansers, performers en composers en beeldende kunstenaars van alle nationaliteiten met als oogpunt artistiek- culturele samenwerking en uitwisseling. Het project omvat een artistieke onderzoek periode met als thema ‘emigratie en immigratie’.
Het project bestaat uit een  intensieve onderzoekperiode met open presentaties en vervolgens de  productieperiode binnen het programma van de Staalkaart Amersfoort in oktober 2007. 

Concept, idee en choreografie Gabriela Zuarez; Componist Katarzyna Glowicka; Beeldende kunstenaar/ video en setting Jan Pronk; Lichtontwerp en techniek Petyr Veenstra; Fotograf: Mirjam van der Werff; Techniek voor audio Tijm van Galen; Pr communicatie Margo Bruininkx; Productie Leider Rodney Arnoldus; Video productie Jan Pronk; Graphic design en ontwerp Ron Jagers; Choreografisch advies Stefania Amirata; Drama docent Nadja Filtzer; Dansdocent Gabriela Zuarez; ROC video productie Thomas Hendriks, Bastian Hagenbeuk en Timon Karssen; Productie Danzalterna, Dance Theatre Works; Ondersteuning Stg. Dance-Theatre Development lid van Internacional Dance Council- Unesco-
Subsidianten: Gemeente Amersfoort en het K.F. Hein Fonds. Sponsors: Locatie De Observant Stadscafé. Stg. Dance-Theatre Development -  International Dance Council- UNESCO, ROC Midden Nederland. In Samenwerking met: Kunstenaars Logies, Staalkaart Amersfoort en Locatie en De Observant Stadscafé. Met dank aan aan:  Argentijnse Ambassade, Ron Jagers, Margo Bruininkx, Rodney Arnoldus, Harmen Zijp, Stadscafé De Observant en John Kamstra.

profile_positions.description:
Theater Sur Mundo Ensemble is a cross-cultural, independent project-based company that comes under the board of the Dance Theatre Development Foundation [DTD stg].

 I specialize in creating thought-provoking performances that explore movement, dance language, and canon, and aim to inspire social awareness and female empowerment. In 2021 I led the branding and launch of the company's new identity.

In recent years, I have worked on a range of exciting projects that have garnered critical acclaim and funding support. 

	Performance production: "𝑫𝑨 𝑪𝑨𝑷𝑶/𝑬𝒆𝒏 𝒓𝒆𝒊𝒔 𝒏𝒂𝒂𝒓 𝒅𝒆 𝒐𝒐𝒓𝒔𝒑𝒓𝒐𝒏𝒈 𝒗𝒂𝒏 𝒉𝒆𝒕 𝒅𝒂𝒏𝒔𝒆𝒏𝒅𝒆 𝒍𝒊𝒄𝒉𝒂𝒂𝒎," which was presented at De Duif Amsterdam and Perdu Theatre Amsterdam. The project was subsidized by AFK Fonds voor de Podium Kunsten and co-financed by Cultuur+ Ondernemen.(2021-2022)

	Dance-film production"Encounters in the Outside, in collaboration with filmmaker Celeste Franco of Ay Caramba Productions. The film was released on Sur Mundo Ensemble YouTube Channel in 2022.

Performance listings of previous years are available on request.
profile_positions.title: Artistic director, Dance Leader, Dramaturge-Choreographer. Project developer

profile_positions.description:
Hybrid Languages is the new Sur Mundo Ensemble transnational dance project, and it goes about the contemporaneity of Tango as a dance identity. 

	Research-Lab project "Hybrid Languages." The project involved a residency, workshop lab, studio presentation, and dance film. I worked closely with BAU Studios, ICK Studios De Vlugt, VMI Patricia Bardi Studios, CREA Studios, and ZID Theater, and received support from SED Cultuur-Ondernemen, ICK Amsterdam, BAU Amsterdam, and VMI Patricia Bardi Studios.
profile_positions.title: Education: Dramaturge- choreographer in- research Hybrid Languages

profile_positions.location: City of Buenos Aires, Buenos Aires Province, Argentina
profile_positions.description:
This is an ongoing exchange project of dance training, creative development, and international choreographic exploration that which have taken place in Buenos Aires and Rosario cities since 2017.

	Residency "Coreo-Lab Holland Argentine" was hosted at JIRA University of the Arts, Centro Cultural Recoleta BA, Club Cultural Matienzo BA, and Instituto Lavarden Rosario. Work-in-progress performances, "R.E.P.R.I.S.E" (2018) and "RESILIENS” (2019), received support from the Embassy of the Netherlands in Argentina, the City Council of Buenos Aires, and Mecenazgo Cultural Argentina. Co-partners included Club Cultural Matienzo Buenos Aires, Lavarden Rosario, and Creative Producer MIKKO Studio, Argentina.

Main supporters Dutch Embassy in Argentina, and the City of Buenos Aires. 
In 2021 Coreo- Lab is receiving as well the support of Mecenazgo Cultural Buenos Aires.
profile_positions.title: Education: Leading Teacher/ Dance Residence Program Coreo-Lab Holanda Argentina

profile_positions.description:
Danzalterna existed since 2003 as an integrative training for dancers. In 2013, it became a middle-sized city council project for dance and yoga classes. Since 2016  Danzalterna is owned by the foundation Dance Theatre Development (SDTD). The type of practice offers tailored trainings and classes based  on body awareness and Yoga, that focusing on the wellness and preventive conditioning of dancers, performers and body workers. In 2020 Danzalterna has been re-branded as a dance & yoga Workplace.

✼ Re- training Contemporary dance 
✼ Conditioning body awareness & Yoga 

Archives:
✼Workshops- production (in collaboration with the theatres)
➤Workshop Choreography, presentation at theater Icoon Amersfoort, November 2013  ✔
➤Workshop- production 'Body, Dance and Performance', February 2015  ✔
➤Presentation of work-in-progress SUCCESS at theater Ostade A'dam, May 2015  ✔

Please check out classes and workshops at ☛ https://www.danzalterna.com
☛ https://www.facebook.com/pages/Danzalterna-Contemporary-Dance-/425007270867815
☛ https://twitter.com/danzalterna
profile_positions.title: Leading Teacher / Dance -Body Awareness- Yoga Practice

company.name: El Sur Mundo Project- Performing Arts-

profile_positions.company: El Sur Mundo Project- Performing Arts-
profile_positions.description:
With El Sur Mundo Project, I have been producing a number of dance works always revolving around the body of Tango since 2001 always in cooperation with Argentinian and European artists and organizations.The company has been re-branded in Sur Mundo Ensemble.
To be mentioned ⌦

➤Díptico' (2013)  ✔  ☛ https://vimeo.com/120064405
➤Kick-off Résumé I/ II' (2011)  ✔  ☛ https://vimeo.com/40417524
➤Site Guys (2009) ✔
➤La Interna-Trío (2008)  ✔  ☛ https://vimeo.com/54235008 
➤La Interna-Duo (2006)  ✔  ☛ https://vimeo.com/54235008 
➤Tangos Imaginarios (2002)  ✔  ☛ https://vimeo.com/40308486
➤Le Voyage (2003)  ✔

Interdisciplinarism is my main tool to generate dance language attempting a new aesthetic that is reinforced on the stage through cultural criticism. All my works are highly critical despite of its metaphorism. My interests lie in subjects of social impact and urge as: exploitation, repression, power and love. In my work I am re-searching for ⌦

✻The hybridization of Tango forms in communion with modern movement languages;
✻The production of meaning in theatre;
✻The emotional deepness of Tango music (preferently composed by Argentinian musicians)
✻The political condition of Tango as contemporaary art form

Please check out my links ☛ https://www.elsurmundoproject.nl
☛ https://www.facebook.com/pages/El-Sur-Mundo-Project-Performing-Arts-/350502475043831/
